page.title: 05The Dunmow Bypass Road
page.content: Great Dunmow is an old town which is situated on a major route running to the ports on the East Coast like Ipswich, Harwich and Felixstowe. With the increase in traffic, especially of container lorries, the route of the A120 through Dunmow caused many problems. Not only was the town centre seriously congested but there were many accidents which injured people and damaged buildings. As a result it was decided that a bypass was needed to take most of the traffic away from the town. The new road was started in 1978 and completed in 1980 with part of its route being along the course of the old railway. One junction of the bypass has proved to be dangerous, and a roundabout is going to be built to improve safety.
